Review Text:
My review of the place comes after multiple visits, that have spanned over 4 months. And now I can safely say that it's one of the good places around.
They're located near the Biodiversity signal, above Fabindia. There's ample parking for both two and four wheelers. The ambience is a bit dim after dark, and the seating is divided into various options, including a PDR section.
The menu design is in the shape of a bottle, and the array spans Continental, Chinese and Indian cuisines. Here's the list of things that I have tried, across all my visits
Panko Crumbed Mozzarella Sticks ❤️ - Cheese sticks that are coated and fried. Pure cheese bliss.
Veg Lasagna ❤️ - This place has one of the good Lasagne in the town.
Crispy Chilli Corn Kernels - The usual favourite, this one has a slightly different presentation here.
Makhmali Paneer Tikka -
Cottage Cheese Shashlik Sizzler
Italian Nachos - Nachos topped with red sauce and cheese, and baked in the dish.
Cheese and Cheese Pizza ❤️ - Soft base pizza, loaded with cheese, and a few pieces of green olives.
I cannot stress enough on how I have loved all that I tried here. I have also tried out their lunch buffet. The variety may not be as elaborate as other places, but with the food quality and the discount that they offer for bulk bookings, it is at least a one-time try. But what I really adore here is their mocktails. Beyond Delight is an absolute delight! Also a fan of the Guava and Chilli, and Apple and Kiwi Night drinks.
The staff is ever so courteous. A special mention to Papiya and Shuvro, who were our attendants on the latest visit. The place has Zomato Gold 1+1, which further brings down their reasonable rates. A meal for two would roughly be around 700, that fills not only your tummy, but also you heart!

Review Text:
Beyond Flavors is true to its name. This place needs no marketing or advertising whatsoever, its customers and food will soon have the city going ga-ga over their food. With decent ambience, great location, private dining option they surpassed my expectations. Liked the presentation of every single dish served. The quantity was also HUGE. One of the few restaurants which serves vegetarian food just as good (or even better) than the non vegetarian dishes. 
We started with some refreshing cocktails - the Kiwi green apple was without a doubt my favorite. Next up was the soup, the vegetable soup was thick and creamy with nice pieces of veggies, I preferred this over the chicken hot & sour soup. We had a bunch of appetizers & mains, however I am listing my favorites below 
Non vegetarian:
Fish and chips were one of the best in the city. It wasn't too oily and were crisp fillets fried to perfection. This was a favorite amongst everybody. 
Kodi Drumstick is a modern twist to drumsticks with rich South Indian flavors. Definitely a must try for spicy food lovers. 
Vegetarian: 
Chilli Honey Lotus Stem - You just cannot miss this dish when you visit this restaurant. it could clearly be their signature dish. Crispy tangy sweet and spicy. A mouth full of flavors. 
Tandoori Melt Mushroom - cheese stuffed mushroom 
Main Course: 
The Bharwan Pistawala murgh was a thick, rich, nutty gravy which went really well with tandoori breads. 
I loved the presentation of their basket Biryani and the fact that the serve ware is completely edible (baked in-house) is very thoughtful for the planet. 
The Biryani was good but definitely not the best. 
Their desserts need improvement and service can be quicker. The lunch buffet is definitely value for money and a hit amongst the corporates as I hear there's a waiting line during lunch hour. Kudos!

Great Dine-in place
So was here for a Sunday Lunch. It is located in gachibowli. Beyond Flavours is spread with a beautiful entrance with a bar area on the right side, leading to the huge dinning area inside.

Tried out various mocktails from their menu, in which the Fruit Punch, pomegranate mojito and most amazing Beyond Delight are the best try outs.
Coming to starters, had an amazing variety... Kung pao chicken, telengana kodi chicken, salt and pepper mushroom, Murg Reshmi kebab, Spinach and cheese Rolls.
Main Course had all the delicious delicacies like Bharwan Pista Wala Murg, Fish Curry, Mutton tikka Masala, and Paneer Tikka Masala. Two types of Rice were also there, one was the new creation Baked Biryani which was very flavorful and the other Mutton Zafrani Pulao which was just lip smacking. For the dessert had coffee caramel pudding, which was average and sizzling Brownie.
Overall a great experience. Definitely a go to place with friends and family and enjoy the food with economical prices.
Recommended!!!

Review Text:
Gachibowli, Madhapur, Hitech city, Kondapur, Kothaguda locations give a competitive market for restaurants with majority IT crowd around and prime focus around quality, quantity & VFM pricing. Such a situation yet Beyond Flavours sailed the wave with its affordable pricing and decent taste. Especially on their Lunch buffets priced at 500INR serving close to 50/60 items on the spread and you can expect a decent crowd waiting even on the weekdays. While I head a lot of mixed reviews around it, I only say to compare the pricing with the decent food on the buffet. (An ala carte dish from a decent dining eatery around Gachibowli costs you a min of 200₹ )
Ambience best experienced in the evenings with the incandescent lamps & minimalistic interior décor accommodating 120pax including PDR’s. Except for 20% of the menu which falls at 340₹, rest all are below 300₹ making it a price for two at 1000INR. Flash your corporate Id Cards and get a Flat 15% off on Dinning until 31st August.
From the food served on the house, I find the fish and chips, makhmali paneer tikka, chilli honey lotus stem, grilled veg lasagna, sabji nizami handi, basket biryani, good. Except for #OrangeLover rest, all mocktails were run-of-the-mill as their pro bartender is on leave. From desserts sizzling brownie (eggless) was good, gazar ka halwa and gulab jamun were okayish.
Overall I find this place okay in all aspects and can be recommended for corporate team lunches.
Location – Opp Biodiversity Park, Gachibowli.

Review Text:
Sometimes you crave amazing looking places while the other times you just want a quaint place where you can Devour your food with a few mocktails. One such place is beyond flavours in Gachibowli. It’s a pretty looking restaurant which serves super delicious food and amazing mocktails. 
Let’s first talk about the mocktails: We tried out a number if mocktails and almost all of them were delicious.We had the guava on fire, blue lagoon, fruit punch, Pomegranate mojito, orange lover  and beyond delight.  Except the blue Lagoon on the mocktails are highly recommended. The blue Lagoon was a bit to Sour for my liking. 
The pomegranate Mojito and the guava on fire were extremely refreshing.Beyond delight and the fruit punch were slightly heavy but on point in terms of flavour. Highly recommended. 
Soups:Tamatar aur Tulsi ka shorba: This was one delicious combination loved  the variation  in the regular tomato soup. The hint of Tulsi in the suit was just perfect. 
Mushroom rich cream soup: This soup is flavourful however it could have been a little thicker inconsistency.
Chicken hot and sour soup: I loved The Tangye sweet and hint of spice in this group. They were generous with the veggies and chicken pieces in the soup. 
Appetizers: 
Paneer tikka: The marination was really tasty and so was the Paneer used. The dish looked extremely colourful however I would have preferred the regular check me instead of the mail and other dipping sauces. 
Salt-and-pepper mushrooms: I was in love with this dish highly recommended simple and delicate flavours. However the dish was slightly overpowered with salt.

Telangana Kodi roast: Frankly I expected More out of this dish. This is basically marinated and fried. I didn’t like the balance of flavours in this. There was something off in this dish. 
Tawa fish fry: This was super delicious fish the marination was amazing and the fish was not very oily. I really enjoyed the flavours.
Overall a good place and I would rate it 4.25/5 
The ambience is lovely here. A special mention of all the lights which are really fancy and look pretty. The staff is courteous and the service is good. I'll definitely visit again.

#6packfoodie goes The Fisherman's Wharf!

Zomato gold experience: 1/5
When we reserve table, we expect to get the seat preference. I booked the table for 2 with seat preference as Outdoor seating. The issue was the lady who was attending us directly said that you've booked indoor seating, when i did show the details about my booking then she said "Outdoor seating cannot be reserved". If this is the case can you guys please update the same in your page. Disappointed.
Finally after the discussion, we decided to sit on the upper floor with a good view, since Outdoor seating cannot be reserved even with the prior booking. Moving on lets go to food.
Ambience: The entire olace has goan vibe to it. The area is huge and there is a lot space between tables. The sections are divided into shack like structures named after the beaches in Goa.
Drinks: LIIT, one of the best LIITs I had in Hyderabad. The lime mint juice was also tasty.
Food: Ordered beef chilly fry. The tenderness of the meat was perfect. Spice level, presentation was worth the price. They have "as per size" menu for their specialities such as lobsters, prawns, Pomfret. We had chose the butter garlic tiger prawns. Again, the presentation and the taste was class apart. The spice balance was fantastic.
Now comes the worst zomato gold experience.
Before ordering as you woukd expect, i unlocked my zomato gold, which means the lowest priced dish is complimentary (beef chilly fry in my case, since it was lower priced among the two).
The guy who served us didn't come with the bill. Another guy came up, saying we cannot give you the lower priced dish as complementary, because "as per size" menu is not included in the zomato gold. Which means you have to pay for everything!!!
This was never mentioned anywhere, neither it was informed to us by the guy who served us amd later camouflaged somewhere.
We had to pay for the entire bill, irrespective of the zomato gold because of unawareness of the staff.
Later ordered one more dish as a take away, which was made complementary.
If potion size and value for money is what you're looking for then this olace is not for you. If you're a sea food lover and want goan ambience in Hyderabad, then thumbs up.
Peace✌🏻
